description: Vol 3, No 1 (2002) Bread and cake cake and bread which is better, I myself think that bread when there is good butter is better than cake, bread and butter but when there is no bread and butter then there is cake Marie Antoinette was quite right about that. [Gertrude Stein, "The Coming of the Americans," in Collected Writings of Gertrude Stein (New York: Vintage Books, 1990), 648.]

is_part_of.title: Women in Judaism: A Multidisciplinary Journal

title: Vol 3, No 1 (2002)
